wikipedia_page.main: John Michael "Mick" Bednarek is a retired United States Army officer. He was chief of the United States Office of Security Cooperation in Iraq and former commander of the United States First Army. Bednarek took command of the First Army on April 6, 2011, from Lieutenant General Thomas G. Miller and was succeeded as commanding officer by Major General Kevin R. Wendel on March 14, 2013 (interim), with Lieutenant General Michael S. Tucker succeeding Bednarek as permanent commander on August 2, 2013.

response: *John Michael Bednarek, Lieutenant General, United States Army
* John Michael Bednarek, US army officer

From 2011 to 2013, Wendel was commander of First Army Division East; during 2013, he was interim commander of First United States Army following the departure of John Michael Bednarek to serve as Chief of the Office of Security Cooperation (OSC) in Iraq, and prior to the arrival of Michael S. Tucker to assume command of First Army.
